Detailed Description

Module orchestrating the advection scheme. The main routine in the module is advection().

Member Function/Subroutine Documentation

subroutine advection::advect ( real(stm_real), dimension(ncell,nvar), intent(out)  mass,
real(stm_real), dimension(ncell,nvar), intent(in)  mass_prev,
real(stm_real), dimension(ncell), intent(in)  flow_prev,
real(stm_real), dimension(ncell), intent(in)  flow_lo,
real(stm_real), dimension(ncell), intent(in)  flow_hi,
real(stm_real), dimension(ncell), intent(in)  area,
real(stm_real), dimension(ncell), intent(in)  area_prev,
real(stm_real), dimension(ncell), intent(in)  area_lo,
real(stm_real), dimension(ncell), intent(in)  area_hi,
integer, intent(in)  ncell,
integer, intent(in)  nvar,
real(stm_real), intent(in)  time,
real(stm_real), intent(in)  dt,
real(stm_real), intent(in)  dx,
logical, intent(in), optional  use_limiter 
)

Integrate advection plus sources for a time step. The final argument to advect is a callback for computing the source term, which should conform to the source_if interface The algoritm looks like this:

  • Convert to primitive variables
  • Extrapolate to faces
    • difference()
    • limiter()
    • extrapolate()
  • upwind()
  • compute_flux()
  • advection_boundary_flux() for boundary and special cases
  • Compute conservative divergence
  • Apply divergence in conservative_update along with Heun's method for sources. Note that all these steps are operations on entire arrays of values -- this keeps things efficient
    Parameters:
    [in]ncellNumber of cells
    [in]nvarNumber of variables
    [out]massmass at new time
    [in]mass_prevmass at old time
    [in]flow_prevcell-centered flow, old time
    [in]flow_loflow on lo side of cells centered in time
    [in]flow_hiflow on hi side of cells centered in time
    [in]area_prevcell-centered area at old time. not used in algorithm?
    [in]areacell-centered area at new time. not used in algorithm?
    [in]area_lolo side area (todo: at new time?)
    [in]area_hihi side area (todo: at new time?
    [in]timenew time
    [in]dtcurrent time step from old time to new time
    [in]dxspatial step
    [in]use_limiterwhether to use slope limiter
subroutine advection::compute_divergence ( real(stm_real), dimension(ncell,nvar), intent(out)  div_flux,
real(stm_real), dimension(ncell,nvar), intent(in)  flux_lo,
real(stm_real), dimension(ncell,nvar), intent(in)  flux_hi,

[in]nvarNumber of variables
[out]div_fluxCell centered flux divergence, time centered
[in]flux_loFlux on lo side of cell, time centered
[in]flux_hiFlux on hi side of cell, time centered

real(stm_real), dimension(ncell,nvar), intent(out)  flux_hi,
real(stm_real), dimension(ncell,nvar), intent(in)  conc_lo,
real(stm_real), dimension(ncell,nvar), intent(in)  conc_hi,
real(stm_real), dimension(ncell), intent(in)  flow_lo,
real(stm_real), dimension(ncell), intent(in)  flow_hi,
integer, intent(in)  ncell,
integer, intent(in)  nvar 
)

Compute the upwinded fluxes The calculation here does not include tributaries, boundaries or special objects.

Parameters:
[in]ncellNumber of cells
[in]nvarNumber of variables
[out]flux_loFlux on lo face at half time
[out]flux_hiFlux on hi face at half time
[in]conc_loupwinded conc at half time at lo face
[in]conc_hiupwinded conc at half time at hi face
[in]flow_lotime-centered flow at lo face
[in]flow_hitime-centered flow at hi face
pure subroutine advection::extrapolate ( real(stm_real), dimension(ncell,nvar), intent(out)  conc_lo,
real(stm_real), dimension(ncell,nvar), intent(out)  conc_hi,
real(stm_real), dimension(ncell,nvar), intent(in)  conc,
real(stm_real), dimension(ncell,nvar), intent(in)  grad,
real(stm_real), dimension(ncell,nvar), intent(in)  source,
real(stm_real), dimension(ncell), intent(in)  flow,
real(stm_real), dimension(ncell), intent(in)  area,
integer, intent(in)  ncell,
integer, intent(in)  nvar,
real(stm_real), intent(in)  time,
real(stm_real), intent(in)  dt,
real(stm_real), intent(in)  dx 
)

Extrapolate primitive data from cell center at the old time to cell edges at the half time. The extrapolation is done by a Taylor series in time and space in which an explicit discretization of the PDE is used to represent the time part.

Parameters:
[in]ncellNumber of cells
[in]nvarNumber of variables
[out]conc_loestimate from this cell extrapolated to lo face at half time
[out]conc_hiestimate from this cell extrapolated to hi face at half time
[in]conccell centered conc at old time
[in]gradcell centered difference of conc at old time, currently assuming these are undivided differences
[in]areacell-centered area at old time
[in]flowcell-centered flow at old time
[in]sourcesource terms at old time
[in]timetime
[in]dtlength of current time step being advanced
[in]dxspatial step
subroutine advection::update_conservative ( real(stm_real), dimension(ncell,nvar), intent(out)  mass,
real(stm_real), dimension(ncell,nvar), intent(in)  mass_prev,
real(stm_real), dimension(ncell,nvar), intent(in)  div_flux,
real(stm_real), dimension(ncell,nvar), intent(in)  source_prev,
real(stm_real), dimension(ncell), intent(in)  area,
real(stm_real), dimension(ncell), intent(in)  area_prev,
integer, intent(in)  ncell,
integer, intent(in)  nvar,
real(stm_real), intent(in)  time,
real(stm_real), intent(in)  dt,
real(stm_real), intent(in)  dx 
)

Update the conservative variables using divergence of fluxes and integrate the source term using Heun's method.

Parameters:
[in]ncellNumber of cells
[in]nvarNumber of variables
[out]massUpdate of mass
[in]mass_prevOld time mass
[in]areaArea of cells
[in]area_prevArea of cells at old time step
[in]source_prevOld time source term
[in]div_fluxFlux divergence, time centered
[in]timeCurrent (new) time
[in]dtLength of current time step
[in]dxSpatial step
